content.text:
# Richard Ewart

Richard Ewart (15 September 1904 â€“ 8 March 1953) was a Labour Party politician in England.  He was elected at the 1945 general election as Member of Parliament (MP) for  Sunderland. When that 2-seat constituency was divided for the 1950 general election, he was returned for the new Sunderland South constituency, which re-elected him in  1951.  He died in office in 1953, aged 48.
